arguments.name: theme
arguments.description: Which theme you want to use. Can be 'classic', 'monolith' or 'nano'

arguments.name: closeOnScroll
arguments.description: Nested scrolling is currently not supported and as this would be really sophisticated to add this it's easier to set this to true which will hide pickr if the user scrolls the area behind it.

arguments.name: appClass
arguments.description: Custom class which gets added to the pcr-app. Can be used to apply custom styles.

arguments.name: useAsButton
arguments.description: Don't replace 'el' Element with the pickr-button, instead use 'el' as a button. If true, appendToBody will also be automatically true.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: If true pickr won't be floating, and instead will append after the in el resolved element. Setting this to true will also set showAlways to true. It's possible to hide it via .hide() anyway.

arguments.name: autoReposition
arguments.description: If true, pickr will be repositioned automatically on page scroll or window resize. Can be set to false to make custom positioning easier.

arguments.name: sliders
arguments.description: Defines the direction in which the knobs of hue and opacity can be moved. 'v' => opacity- and hue-slider can both only moved vertically. 'hv' => opacity-slider can be moved horizontally and hue-slider vertically. Can be used to apply custom layouts

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description: Start state. If true 'disabled' will be added to the button's classlist.

arguments.name: lockOpacity
arguments.description: If true, the user won't be able to adjust any opacity. Opacity will be locked at 1 and the opacity slider will be removed. The HSVaColor object also doesn't contain an alpha, so the toString() methods just print HSV, HSL, RGB, HEX, etc.

arguments.name: outputPrecision
arguments.description: Precision of output string (only effective if components.interaction.input is true)

arguments.name: comparison
arguments.description: If set to false it would directly apply the selected color on the button and preview.

arguments.name: comparison
arguments.description: Default color

arguments.name: swatches
arguments.description: Optional color swatches. When null, swatches are disabled. Types are all those which can be produced by pickr e.g. hex(a), hsv(a), hsl(a), rgb(a), cmyk, and also CSS color names like 'magenta'. Example: swatches: ['#F44336', '#E91E63', '#9C27B0', '#673AB7'],

arguments.name: defaultRepresentation
arguments.description: Default color representation of the input/output textbox. Valid options are HEX, RGBA, HSVA, HSLA and CMYK.

arguments.name: showAlways
arguments.description: Option to keep the color picker always visible. You can still hide / show it via 'pickr.hide()' and 'pickr.show()'. The save button keeps its functionality, so still fires the onSave event when clicked.

arguments.name: closeWithKey
arguments.description: Close pickr with a keypress. Default is 'Escape'. Can be the event key or code. (see: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/key)

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Defines the position of the color-picker. Any combinations of top, left, bottom or right with one of these optional modifiers: start, middle, end Examples: top-start / right-end If clipping occurs, the color picker will automatically choose its position.

arguments.name: adjustableNumbers
arguments.description: Enables the ability to change numbers in an input field with the scroll-wheel. To use it set the cursor on a position where a number is and scroll, use ctrl to make steps of five

arguments.name: onSave
arguments.description: User clicked the save / clear button. Also fired on clear with null as color.

arguments.name: onClear
arguments.description: Called after user cleared the color.

arguments.name: onChange
arguments.description: Called after color has changed (but not saved). Also fired on swatchselect.

arguments.name: onCancel
arguments.description: Called after user clicked the cancel button (return to previous color).

arguments.name: onSwatchSelect
arguments.description: Called after user clicked one of the swatches.
